definition: to be at the scene (sitting for an exam, performing, competing, giving directions etc)/firsthand (experience)/impromptu (remarks etc)
to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
the feeling of actually being there

sentences.english: Most of them are experienced in the practice of teaching but are inexperienced in the practice for great matches.
sentences.chinese: 有着豐富的教學實踐經驗，但缺乏大賽臨場指揮經驗。

sentences.english: How many of you are Doming to the party next week?
sentences.chinese: 你們有幾多人下週要降臨場晚會？

sentences.english: Even the seasoned troupers fall apart.
sentences.chinese: 甚至一些有臨場經驗的演員也失常了。
沒有氣定神閒的臨場感。

sentences.english: She hadn't studied for the exam, so she decided to wing it.
sentences.chinese: 她沒有爲考試準備，所以決定臨場發揮。

sentences.english: I don't know what to say when he comes, just play it by ear.
sentences.chinese: 我沒時間來準備這次會議，我只能臨場發揮了。

sentences.english: Do come to the party tomorrow evening.
sentences.chinese: 明天晚上絕對於是實義德科技降臨場晚會。

sentences.english: Small red face for money nolle prosequi, make Tian Ge is hit.
sentences.chinese: 小紅爲了錢而臨場撤訴，使田歌受到打擊。

sentences.english: He played at the top level and has vast experience in the game.
sentences.chinese: 他有着非常高的執教水平，臨場指揮經驗也極爲豐富。

sentences.english: That all thanks to our leaders' calmness and wittiness .
sentences.chinese: 這真是多虧幹部們的臨場冷靜與機智。

sentences.english: That all thanks to our leaders' calmness and wittiness.
sentences.chinese: 這真是多虧領導們的臨場冷靜與機智。

definition: battlefield situation/battle progress
tactics
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
lit. an easy drive on a familiar path (idiom); fig. experience makes progress easy/a task that is so familiar one can do it with one's hand tied behind one's back
to do battle (with sb)
(idiom) fully displaying one's capabilities
to turn white-hot/to intensify/to reach a climax
lit. two armies have equivalent banners and drums (idiom); fig. evenly matched/roughly comparable (opponents)
to boost support or interest/to campaign/to promote
evenly matched (idiom)
to spar/to fight/to duke it out
could happen at any moment/on the verge
ambition/ambitious
to dispatch/to assign/a dispatch
fighting/killing
to have a competition/to measure with one's hand or arm/to make a gesture of measuring
